text: Psalm 149
Praise to God for His Future Judgment
Praise Yah.\f + \fr 149:1 \ft Hebrew \fqa hallelujah \ft  \f*
Sing to Yahweh a new song,
his praise in \add the\add* assembly of \add the\add* faithful.
Let Israel be glad in its maker;
let the children of Zion rejoice in their king.
Let them praise his name with dancing;
let them sing praises to him with tambourine and lyre.
For Yahweh takes pleasure in his people;
he glorifies \add the\add* afflicted with salvation.
Let \add the\add* faithful exult in glory;
let them sing for joy on their beds.
Let the extolling of God \add be\add* in their throat,
and a double-edged sword in their hand,
to execute vengeance on the nations
\add and\add* punishment on \add the\add* peoples,\f + \fr 149:7 \ft Reading against the MT and with the LXX \f*
to bind their kings with chains
and their ⸤nobles⸥\f + \fr 149:8 \ft Literally “honorable ones” \f* with fetters of iron,
to execute on them \add the\add* judgment that is decreed.\f + \fr 149:9 \ft Hebrew “written” \f*
This \add will be\add* honor for all his faithful ones;
Praise Yah.\f + \fr 149:9 \ft Hebrew \fqa hallelujah \ft  \f*
